description_txt: stated on January 4, 2015 in an interview on CBS's "Face the Nation":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama got "a pass" over controversal remarks by Rev. Jeremiah Wright, while a 12-year-old speech by House Majority Whip Steve Scalise has blown up into a national story.

description_txt: stated on December 19, 2014 in a list of talking points:
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush "not only opposes marriage equality, he’s said he ‘personally’ believes gay couples should be banned from adopting children."

description_txt: stated on January 1, 2015 in a chain email:
quote_txt: New tax increases that went into effect on Jan. 1, 2015, "all passed under the Affordable Care Act, aka Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2015 in comments on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama's own administration has done five environmental impact assessments of the Keystone XL pipeline, "all of which have said it would have a minimum impact on the environment."

description_txt: stated on January 4, 2015 in comments on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: "We're now the No. 1 producer of oil in the world. We've surpassed Saudi Arabia."

description_txt: stated on December 3, 2014 in an interview.:
quote_txt: Regarding sexual assault against women, "It’s actually safer not to be in college than it is to be in college."

description_txt: stated on November 24, 2014 in a newspaper commentary:
quote_txt: Exposure to the electromagnetic fields from power lines "has been associated with childhood leukemia and other diseases."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • January 2, 2015

description_txt: stated on December 28, 2014 in a panel discussion on "Fox News Sunday":
quote_txt: "We've caught Iran cheating on the interim (nuclear) deal."

description_txt: stated on November 22, 2014 in a Facebook post.:
quote_txt: Graduation rates of players at major football colleges "are still twenty points below their male campus peers and worsened in the past three years."

description_txt: stated on November 21, 2014 in a news release.:
quote_txt: "The President has decided to move forward with executive actions on immigration that he has said on numerous occasions that he didn’t have the constitutional power to take."

description_txt: stated on December 17, 2014 in a press release:
quote_txt: "Texas families have kept more than $10 billion in their family budgets since we successfully fought to restore Texas' sales tax deduction a decade ago."

description_txt: stated on December 18, 2014 in a press conference:
quote_txt: Says that in 2008, President Barack Obama said normalization with Cuba would first require "liberation of all political prisoners and some basic steps toward freedom, including freedom of the press, political parties, labor unions."

description_txt: stated on December 21, 2014 in an interview on Fox News:
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama has said "that everybody should hate the police."

description_txt: stated on December 14, 2014 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: The United States "decided waterboarding was torture back when we court-martialed American soldiers for waterboarding Philippine insurgents in the Philippine revolution."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • December 23, 2014

description_txt: stated on November 22, 2014 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: Only 20 colleges and universities "have athletic departments with revenue exceeding expenses."

description_txt: stated on December 7, 2014 in an interview on Meet the Press:
quote_txt: "My wife is going to be the first Hispanic first lady in the history of Texas."

description_txt: stated on November 22, 2014 in a Facebook post:
quote_txt: "We have a system now where in 40 states, the highest-paid public employee is the state university’s head football or basketball coach."

description_txt: stated on December 21, 2014 in comments on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: "We're spending millions for each individual" held at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

description_txt: stated on December 21, 2014 in comments on CNN's "State of the Union":
quote_txt: Since the United States began negotiations with Iran, "that's probably the first year and a half in which Iran has not advanced its nuclear program in the last decade."

description_txt: stated on December 6, 2014 in a commentary in The Providence Journal:
quote_txt: "Surveys of teens in high school reveal that knowing a classmate who sells cannabis is 90 times more common than knowing a classmate who sells alcohol."

description_txt: stated on December 17, 2014:
quote_txt: "The reason why Cubans don't have access to 21st century telecommunications — like smart phones, like access to the Internet — is because it is illegal in Cuba."

description_txt: stated on December 11, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: Two-thirds of the federal budget is "permanent law ... it's permanently appropriated."

description_txt: stated on December 10, 2014 in a recent report:
quote_txt: Georgia has had 12 school shootings in the two years since the mass killing at Sandy Hook Elementary School, more than any other state.

description_txt: stated on December 17, 2014 in an interview on CNN's "Anderson Cooper":
quote_txt: "A lot of what (Cuba’s) survival depends on is Venezuelan oil money, which is drying up."

description_txt: stated on December 17, 2014 in a press conference:
quote_txt: In the U.S. agreement with the Cuban government, "no commitment was made to allowing the establishment of political parties or to even begin the semblance of a transition to a democracy."

description_txt: stated on December 14, 2014 in the Sunday comics:
quote_txt: Says 3,000 Americans "died of gunfire" between the time of the Ebola scare in Dallas and the midterm elections.

description_txt: stated on December 10, 2014 in his farewell U.S. House speech:
quote_txt: "This Congress made history as the least productive, most unpopular Congress in the history of this proud nation."

description_txt: stated on December 12, 2014 in a tweet:
quote_txt: "My property taxes went down largely because my technical college portion went down 35.5% because of the money we put in at state."

description_txt: stated on December 16, 2014 in an interview with the French television network France 24:
quote_txt: "Congress is a very special group of people. More than 80 percent of them never left the United States."

description_txt: stated on December 6, 2014 in a speech:
quote_txt: Texas House Speaker Joe Straus said, ‘I do not care if Wallace Hall swings from a tree.’
